Projects

Note: The majority of my work was deployed inside the company firewall, and as such is not accessible from here, nor was it acceptable to take sample screenshots, diagrams, or code from the initiatives.

Software Product Registry

Case Study

Qualcomm Technologies, Inc.

Oct 2018 - Feb 2021

A system of record for Open Source software composition created to address the question, “What Open Source is used in my product?”

  • Led the user experience design for new legal analysis tooling; delivered persuasive design arguments resulting in improved analyst efficiency by negating the need for repetitive scanning and review of subsequent software versions.

  • Designed and produced software bill of materials (SBOM) reports for compliance teams to understand the overall licensing and copyright concerns for a given product tree.

  • Skills: Agile Methodologies · Visual Storytelling · Analytical Skills · User Interface Prototyping · Graphic User Interface (GUI) Design · User Experience Design (UED) · Redux.js · UX Research · Application Development · Front-End Design · Technical Requirements · Cross-functional Collaborations · Cross-team Collaboration · React.js

CodeLinaro

Qualcomm Technologies, Inc.

Jan 2020 - May 2023

An Open Source software distribution platform partnership with Linaro Ltd. focused on security, automation, and customer success.

  • Successfully migrated Qualcomm’s global Engineering organization to new business process automation and security practices related to the publishing of Open Source software artifacts.

  • Acted as primary liaison and User Experience consultant to the Linaro engineering team, focusing on UI/UX best practices for partner enablement and customer success.

  • Led the Operations track; established internal practices and procedures including engineering user guides, operational playbooks, live and recorded trainings, and more.

  • Matrix-managed a team of five engineers related to CLO backend automation, security, and operational support, including agile-based development and roadmap planning.

Qualcomm Innovation Center

Qualcomm Technologies, Inc.

Feb 2021 - May 2023

This GitHub Pages site was part of a cross-functional rebranding and relaunch of the Qualcomm Innovation Center's web presence.

  • Partnered with Corporate Marketing and senior leadership in QuIC to produce and promote this initiative.

  • Although this page was decomissioned in mid-2024, if you're patient, the Internet Archive has a copy here.
